description: The scene depicts a stark contrast between an upstairs environment resembling a demonic ritual and a mundane downstairs living room. A monstrous figure addresses a robed congregation with raised arms in the upper level, while below, a man slouches on the floor, seemingly agitated by something he perceives from above. The absurdity lies in the man's declaration that he will go "up there" and "give those people hell," flipping the conventional idea of hell coming downwards. This juxtaposition of the seemingly horrific and the domestic complaint creates a surreal, darkly humorous situation rooted in the unexpected reaction to the extraordinary.
caption: “That does it! ... I’m going to go up there and give those people hell!”
